refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: Ctrlproxy uses a configuration directory called .ctrlproxy that lives inside the users' home directory. The main configuration file lives in this directory and is called config. It is an ini-style configuration file with sections and key-value pairs.
This manpage discusses the variables that can be set in this file in a standard ControlProxy installation.

refsect2.title: [global]
refsect2.para: The [global] section contains some of the most important settings.

refsect2.title: [admin]
refsect2.para: If the [admin] section is present, ControlProxy will create a fake network with a control channel that can be used for administration.

refsect2.title: [log-irssi]
refsect2.para: If the [log-irssi] section is present, ControlProxy will write irssi-style log files to ~/.ctrlproxy/log-irssi/NETWORK/CHANNEL.

refsect2.title: [socks]
refsect2.para: If the [socks] section is present, ControlProxy will listen for SOCKS connections.
